meanings.definition: Substances in blood that cause particles to clump together.
meanings.sent1: The agglutinins in the blood helped the particles stick together.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use agglutinins to study how particles clump in the blood.
meanings.sent3: The agglutinins in the blood decided to have a party and invited all the particles to join.
meanings.sent4: The agglutinins acted like magnets, pulling the particles closer together.
meanings.sent5: The agglutinins were like glue, binding the particles tightly.

meanings.definition: Antibodies that cause agglutination of cells or particles.
meanings.sent1: The agglutinins fought off the harmful cells in the body.
meanings.sent2: The agglutinins targeted specific cells for destruction.
meanings.sent3: The agglutinins threw a party and invited all the cells to stick together.
meanings.sent4: The agglutinins were like traffic police, directing cells to clump together.
meanings.sent5: The agglutinins were like bodyguards, protecting the cells by making them stick together.
